vstore.android_filebox.utils

Class Connectivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • vstore.android_filebox.utils.Connectivity

  • public class Connectivity
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods to check device's network connectivity and speed A lot of code in this class comes from user emil on stackoverflow (http://stackoverflow.com/users/220710/emil)

      • isConnectedFast

        public static boolean isConnectedFast(android.content.Context c)
        Check if there is fast connectivity (e.g. > 1Mbps)
        Parameters:
        c - The Android context
        Returns:
        True, if connection is faster than 1Mbps

      • isConnectionFast

        public static boolean isConnectionFast(int type,
                                       int subType)
        Check if the connection is fast (e.g. > 1Mbps)
        Parameters:
        type - The type of network, see constants in TelephonyManager.
        subType - The subtype of network, see constants in TelephonyManager.
        Returns:
        True, if the network is fast

      • getMobileNetworkClass

        public static vstore.framework.context.types.network.cellular.CellularNetwork.MobileType getMobileNetworkClass(android.content.Context c)
        Determines, to what type of mobile network the device is connected.
        Parameters:
        c - The Android context
        Returns:
        "Unknown" or for GPRS, EDGE, CDMA it returns 2G. for UMTS it returns 3G. for HSUPA, HSDPA it returns 3.5G. for LTE it returns 4G.

      • getWifiName

        public static java.lang.String getWifiName(android.content.Context c)
        Reads the name of the current WiFi from the Android WiFi manager, if a WiFi is available.
        Parameters:
        c - The Android context
        Returns:
        The WiFi name, if available. An empty string otherwise.
